name: Forest Park
description: Forest Park, which is owned and operated by the City of St. Louis, is considered one of the nation’s greatest urban public parks. The Park’s 1,300 acres feature beautiful landscapes sprinkled with forests, ecosystems, nature reserves, lakes and streams, as well as five of the region’s major cultural institutions and endless opportunities for recreation. attracting 15.5 million visitors each year.

name: Saint Louis Art Museum
description: The Saint Louis Art Museum, located in the heart of Forest Park, is one of the premier art institutions in the country. Housed in a stunning Beaux-Arts building originally designed for the 1904 World's Fair, the museum offers an impressive collection of art spanning 5,000 years and cultures from around the globe. From ancient artifacts to contemporary masterpieces, visitors can explore galleries filled with renowned works of art. Best of all, admission to the museum’s permanent collection is free, making world-class art accessible to everyone, year-round. Special exhibitions may require a fee, but the museum’s core offerings are open to the public without charge.

name: The City Museum
description: The City Museum in downtown St. Louis is a one-of-a-kind attraction that defies traditional museum expectations. Housed in a repurposed 10-story shoe factory, it blends art, architecture, and pure imagination to create an immersive, hands-on experience for visitors of all ages. The museum is a massive playground, featuring giant slides, tunnels, secret passageways, and a rooftop Ferris wheel, all crafted from reclaimed materials. From exploring intricate caves to climbing through suspended airplanes and buses, the City Museum is an adventure around every corner. It’s not just a museum – it’s a place where creativity, exploration, and fun take center stage.

name: Saint Louis Zoo
description: The Saint Louis Zoo is a world-class destination that offers free admission, making it one of the most beloved attractions in the city. Located in Forest Park, the zoo is home to over 14,000 animals representing nearly 500 species from around the globe. Known for its dedication to animal conservation and care, the zoo provides visitors with the chance to explore beautifully designed habitats, from the African Savanna to the Penguin & Puffin Coast. The zoo also features interactive exhibits, educational programs, and seasonal events, making it a must-visit for families and animal lovers alike. Whether you're watching majestic big cats or playful sea lions, the Saint Louis Zoo promises an unforgettable experience.

name: Mural Mile
description: Mural Mile in St. Louis is an extraordinary display of urban art, stretching along the floodwall near the Mississippi River for over a mile. This outdoor gallery showcases vibrant, large-scale murals created by local and international graffiti artists. Each piece is a stunning example of street art, ranging from intricate portraits to abstract designs and bold lettering. The constantly evolving nature of Mural Mile ensures there’s always something new to see, as artists frequently refresh the wall with their creative expressions. The murals not only reflect the artistic talent in St. Louis but also serve as a canvas for community voices and cultural stories. It’s a must-see for art lovers and anyone looking to experience the city’s creative pulse in an open-air setting.

name: Missouri Botanical Garden
description: The Missouri Botanical Garden in St. Louis is a world-renowned oasis of beauty and nature, offering visitors a tranquil escape just minutes from the city center. Founded in 1859, it is one of the oldest botanical gardens in the United States and is widely recognized for its stunning landscapes, conservation efforts, and horticultural research. Spanning 79 acres, the garden features a breathtaking array of themed gardens, including the serene Japanese Garden, the vibrant Climatron greenhouse, and seasonal flower displays that delight year-round. Whether you're strolling through historic Victorian gardens or exploring tropical rainforests, the Missouri Botanical Garden is a living museum of plant life that offers both education and inspiration. Special events and exhibits make it a family-friendly destination, with something for everyone to enjoy.

name: The Foundry
description: The St. Louis Foundry is a vibrant mixed-use development that blends modern entertainment, dining, shopping, and workspaces in the heart of the city. Located near the Cortex Innovation District, it offers a dynamic environment with restaurants, breweries, boutique shops, and flexible office spaces. The Foundry is designed to foster community engagement, creativity, and innovation, making it a popular destination for locals and visitors alike.

name: Science Center
description: The St. Louis Science Center is a dynamic and interactive museum that offers hands-on exhibits and immersive experiences in science, technology, and space exploration. Located in Forest Park, it's one of the few free science centers in the U.S., making it a popular destination for families, students, and curious minds. Visitors can explore topics ranging from dinosaurs to outer space, all while engaging with cutting-edge technology and educational activities.

name: 801 Chophouse
description: Prime cuts of beef, seafood & a large wine selection offered in an elegant, clubby setting.

name: Louie
description: A cozy neighborhood spot serving wood-fired pizzas, handmade pasta, and great wine. Enjoy outdoor seating, expertly crafted cocktails, and vegetarian-friendly dishes in a warm, inviting atmosphere.

name: SUSHI KOI
description: A modern sushi bar with vibrant decor, serving Japanese small plates, tea, and cocktails. Enjoy outdoor seating, vegetarian options, and a great spot to watch sports.
address: 4 N Euclid Ave, St. Louis, MO 63108

name: Brasserie by Niche
description: A classic French brasserie serving dinner and weekend brunch in an elegant space with a wall of windows overlooking the street. Enjoy outdoor seating, a private dining room, and expertly crafted cocktails.

name: Egg@midtown
description: A vibrant eatery with Tunisian influences, offering a mix of modern and traditional brunch fare. Enjoy outdoor seating, creative cocktails, and vegetarian-friendly options in a lively atmosphere.

name: Esca
description: A cozy spot serving rustic Mediterranean dishes, expertly cooked over charcoal or wood. Enjoy great cocktails, happy hour bites, and plenty of vegetarian options in a warm, inviting setting.

name: Peacemaker Lobster & Crab
description: A rustic eatery with retro accents and vintage fishermen photos, serving fresh lobster, po' boys, shrimp, and a raw bar. Enjoy outdoor seating, great cocktails, and a family-friendly atmosphere with high chairs available.

name: Basso
description: A stylish underground American-Italian restaurant specializing in wood-fired pizzas, house-made pastas, and a curated selection of wines and beers. Enjoy cozy vibes with a fireplace, great cocktails, and delicious happy hour bites.

name: Blood & Sand
description: An upscale, members-only parlor serving craft cocktails and inventive New American cuisine in an elegant setting. Reservations are required, and the menu includes vegetarian-friendly options alongside expertly crafted drinks.
address: 1500 St Charles St, St. Louis, MO 63103

name: The Gramophone
description: A lively Grove hotspot serving sandwiches and a wide selection of beer from lunchtime to late night. Enjoy outdoor seating, great cocktails, and a vibrant atmosphere with DJs and live music—no reservations needed.

name: Adriana's on the Hill
description: Longtime family-owned cafe offering Sicilian lunch fare in a quaint, counter-service setting.

name: Clementine's Naughty & Nice Ice Cream
description: A beloved ice cream shop known for its rich, handcrafted flavors, including boozy "Naughty" creations and classic "Nice" options. Offering a mix of indulgent and innovative flavors, Clementine’s is a must-visit for ice cream lovers seeking a unique, small-batch treat.
address: 308 N Euclid Ave, St. Louis, MO 63108

name: Cafe Napoli
description: Nestled in the heart of Clayton, Cafe Napoli is a lively, upscale Italian restaurant known for its house-made pastas, prime steaks, and fresh seafood. With expertly crafted dishes, fine wines, and handcrafted cocktails, it’s the perfect spot for a memorable dining experience.

name: Pizzeoli Wood Fired Pizza
description: A laid-back spot specializing in Naples-style pizzas with vegetarian and vegan toppings. Enjoy great cocktails, beer, and wine in a casual setting with family-friendly options, including high chairs.

name: Salt + Smoke
description: Salt + Smoke is a St. Louis BBQ favorite, serving award-winning smoked meats, bold flavors, and generous portions. Dine in, cater, or get BBQ shipped nationwide. Find them at Delmar, Hampton, St. Charles, and Ballpark Village.

name: Florentin
description: Florentin is an Israeli-inspired eatery serving a mostly vegetarian menu inspired by Tel Aviv’s street food scene. From shakshuka and falafel to smoothies and pastries, it’s an all-day spot for coffee, breakfast, and lunch. With sit-down and counter service, Chef Ben Poremba’s latest venture brings the vibrant flavors and Bohemian spirit of Tel Aviv’s Florentin neighborhood to life.

name: Bolyard's Meat & Provisions
description: Whole-animal butcher shop making charcuterie, sausages, and provisions also offers lunch and brunch.

name: Menya Rui
description: Menya Rui is a beloved St. Louis ramen shop known for its dedication to authentic Japanese flavors. Serving house-made noodles in rich, aromatic broths, the menu features shoyu ramen, tsukemen, and mazemen, alongside crispy karaage and refreshing drinks. With a casual, no-reservations policy and a fast-moving line, Menya Rui offers an immersive ramen experience that stays true to Japanese tradition. Located in Lindenwood Park, it’s a must-visit for ramen lovers looking for expertly crafted bowls in a cozy, 24-seat space.

name: SmashEm's Burger Bar
description: SmashEms’ Burger Bar by SC Lounge is a late-night smash burger spot in Tower Grove South, run by former Stella Blues chef Kevin Haskins. Serving up simple yet flavorful double-patty smash burgers on potato buns with grilled onions, the menu also features crispy double-fried wings, sandwiches, and craft cocktails. Located inside SC Lounge, just steps from Amsterdam Tavern, guests can order via QR codes at the soccer pub. Open Wednesday–Sunday from 3 p.m. to 1 a.m., SmashEms’ is set to expand hours, bringing back the old-school late-night diner vibe to St. Louis.
address: 3169 Morgan Ford Rd, St. Louis, MO 63116

name: Jack Nolen's
description: A laid-back neighborhood tavern with a tin ceiling and a cozy patio, serving up hearty burgers, sandwiches, and classic sides. Enjoy great cocktails in a relaxed setting—no reservations needed.

name: Al's Restaurant
description: A timeless upscale steakhouse serving classic dishes since 1925, known for its expertly prepared steaks, including the iconic Steak Diane. With a private dining room and expertly crafted cocktails, this elegant spot requires reservations for an unforgettable dining experience.

name: Telva at The Ridge
description: Cozy cafe serving wood-fire roasted Balkan-style coffee, plus open-faced sandwiches and sweets.
address: 60 N Gore Ave, Webster Groves, MO 63119

name: Olive + Oak
description: Olive + Oak is a lively neighborhood restaurant and bar, serving thoughtfully crafted food alongside handpicked wines, craft beers, and well-made cocktails. With a focus on high-quality, locally sourced ingredients and classic cooking techniques, it’s the perfect spot for both casual nights out and special occasions. Warm, welcoming, and detail-driven, Olive + Oak offers an inviting dining experience where great food and drinks bring people together.
address: 216 W Lockwood Ave, Webster Groves, MO 63119

name: Blackthorn Pub and Pizza
description: A relaxed spot serving classic and Chicago-style pizzas, along with cocktails and vegetarian options. Enjoy outdoor seating and live music on select nights—no reservations needed.

name: Mac's Local Eats
description: A casual burger joint inside Bluewood Brewing Company, serving up delicious burgers made with locally-raised meat. Enjoy great cocktails, vegan options, and outdoor seating in a laid-back brewery setting.

name: Brennan's
description: Brennan’s has been a Central West End staple since 2003, offering expertly crafted cocktails, fine wine, and craft beer in a welcoming atmosphere. Featuring a main bar, a stylish Green Room lounge, and a members-only cigar lounge with an extensive vinyl collection, it’s a go-to spot for drinks, conversation, and unique experiences. With rooftop dining at Maryland House, bottled cocktails for pickup or delivery, and private event spaces, Brennan’s continues to be a premier destination for St. Louis nightlife.
address: 316 N Euclid Ave, St. Louis, MO 63108

name: Sasha's
description: A cozy hangout with locations in Shaw and DeMun, serving cheese plates, small bites, and a curated wine list. Enjoy great cocktails, live music, and outdoor seating in a relaxed, inviting atmosphere.

name: Idol Wolf at 21c St. Louis
description: Idol Wolf brings a playful twist to Spanish tapas, blending Iberian traditions with a Midwestern flair for a uniquely cravable dining experience. Located at 1528 Locust Street, this OpenTable Diners’ Choice 2024 restaurant offers a vibrant menu of small plates, creative cocktails, and an extensive wine and spirits selection. With a stylish lounge, billiards, and private dining options, Idol Wolf is perfect for both casual nights out and special occasions. Enjoy dinner, weekend brunch, and a rotating selection of contemporary art from the adjoining 21c Museum Hotel.

name: Coma Coffee Roasters
description: Bright, busy cafe preparing coffee drinks plus pastries and light fare.
address: 1034 S Brentwood Blvd Suite 101, Richmond Heights, MO 63117

name: Omen Coffee Company
description: Trendy coffee shop with a curated menu of coffees, teas, and pastries, plus Sunday yoga classes.

name: Northwest Coffee Roasting
description: Hip coffeehouse with an antique roaster & a patio offering beans, coffee drinks & pastries.

name: Pop's Blue Moon
description: Homey, eclectic space for drinks, live music nightly & regular open-mike nights.

name: Shaw's Coffee
description: Airy, window-lined coffeehouse offering coffee drinks, baked goods & a few light lunch items.

name: East • West
description: Charming store for contemporary men's casualwear, including brand-name jeans, shirts & jackets.
address: 387 N Euclid Ave, St. Louis, MO 63108

name: Arch Apparel
description: St. Louis inspired streetwear. T-shirts, hoodies, sweatshirts, kids, baby, toddler, accessories, and home goods inspired by the Lou.

name: The Cheshire
description: The Cheshire is a luxury hotel that stirs the imagination and warms the spirit. With an authentic British-inspired aesthetic, we offer a unique, personalized alternative to cookie-cutter branded hotels in St. Louis. Centrally located and close to Washington University and Forest Park, our hotel is the ideal business and social hub for travelers seeking something different.

name: 801 Fish
description: Upscale restaurant & bar serving seafood & steak in a chic, contemporary atmosphere.

name: Taco Buddha
description: Best Tacos and Margaritas in St. Louis. Counter serve producing unexpected taco fillings inspired by cuisines from around the world.

name: Three Sixty Rooftop Bar
description: Swanky indoor/outdoor rooftop bar & eatery with 360-degree views, including into Busch Stadium.

name: UpBar
description: Drinks and eats such as tacos, nachos, and signature cocktails offered in a casual space with a patio and city views.
address: 3763 Forest Park Ave, St. Louis, MO 63108

name: HighBar
description: Experience industrial-chic vibes at High Bar Clayton MO, atop the AC Hotel St. Louis. Savor American-style tapas while enjoying breathtaking skyline views.
address: 227 S Central Ave 11th Floor, Clayton, MO 63105

name: Fox and Hounds
description: This cozy pub is a re-creation of a gathering room in an English home where the host might entertain his guests before and after a vigorous hunt. Pull up a stool at the bar or relax in a plush chair by the big stone fireplace and choose a favorite from our extensive drink list.
address: 6300 Clayton Road 63117 Saint Louis United States

name: Flight Club St. Louis
description: Located in the Clayton Business District and close to Forest Park, Flight Club is an upscale entertainment concept combining elevated food and beverage menus with dynamic tech-enabled Social Darts

name: Up-Down STL
description: Up-Down St. Louis features more than 60 arcade games from the ‘80s and ‘90s, pinball machines, four classic skee-ball alleys, Nintendo 64 console gaming, life-size Jenga and Connect Four.
address: 405 N Euclid Ave, St. Louis, MO 63108

name: The Cathedral Basilica of St. Louis
description: The Cathedral Basilica of Saint Louis, also known as the Saint Louis Cathedral or the New Cathedral,[3][4] is a Catholic cathedral in the Central West End neighborhood of St. Louis, Missouri. Completed in 1914, it is the mother church of the Archdiocese of St. Louis and the seat of Archbishop Mitchell T. Rozanski. The cathedral is named for Saint Louis and was designated a basilica by Pope John Paul II in 1997.[5]
